div1.p: Carter appreciates Kean's review of the biography of Gorgas, but has no knowledge to support Kean's points since he was not in Havana during Reed's investigation. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

March 11, 1925.
My Dear General Kean:
div1.p:
I am much obliged to you for the copy of The Military Surgeon
containing your review of the Biography of General Gorgas. Also, I
was glad to hear from you.

Of many of the points you note I have no personal knowledge, as
I left Havana before Reed's investigation was fairly begun and, of
course, have no access to Departmental files.
div1.closer:
Again thanking you, I remain
Very truly yours, H.R. Carter General Jefferson Randolph Kean,
The Military Surgeon,
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D. C.
